hanzi-su-wiki:
譲

Значения

Уступать; откладывать, отсрочивать

Мнемоника

Вести совместные 襄 речи 言, уступая собеседнику и позволяя выговориться. В начале книг — «позвольте, разрешите...»

Варианты

讓, 让, 誏
purpleculture_pinyin:
ràng
Japanese variant of 让
Японский вариант let
rtega_mnemonic:
讓讓RS
让让		譲allow, permit, yield, concede, turn over
  • words 言 that help 襄/㐮
  • ⓢ words 讠 that help one go up 上: allow or permit
  • ⓢ someone in charge says 讠 something which applies above 上 all else
heisig_constituent: defer, say, words, keitai, mouth, grass skirt, top hat, eight, six, animal legs, celery, scarf
koohiiStory1: Speaking complicated words to set her head spinning, the island girl in the grass skirt says demurely "I defer (yield) to your judgment, wise one".
koohiiStory2: I talked to my Japanese spouse, who confirmed that this kanji does not mean "defer" as in "put off, delay". It means "defer" in the sense of "submit" or "yield".
jp_example_words:
譲歩(じょうほ): concession, conciliation, compromise
譲る(ゆずる): turn over, assign, hand over, transmit, convey, sell, dispose of, yield, surrender
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you say "Nurse!" you're ready to defer to them.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: If you say "nurse" you're asking something of a nurse. For this story, pretend like you don't know what to do, so you're going to defer to their skill and let them take over.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You defer to the nurse because you're trying to save the local farmhand, Jourm (じょう), and you can't do it. He's bleeding a lot, and you don't know what to do.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: It makes sense to defer to the knowledge of a medical professional. When going through this story, imagine yourself trying to revive Jourm, but nothing you do works. That's why you defer to the nurse. "Save Jourm," you say. "He's just a simple, kinda weird, ten foot tall farmhand with nine toes."
Ru_Radicals: 亠 (крышка), ハ, 衣 (одежда), 言 (слово)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: if you wear six lots of clothes together (㐮) your words (言) will make them yield

Name meaning

ràng
яп. вм. 让
Radicals: 言, 㐮  (say, nurse)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you say "Nurse!" you're ready to defer to them.
If you say "nurse" you're asking something of a nurse. For this story, pretend like you don't know what to do, so you're going to defer to their skill and let them take over.
Reading Mnemonic
You defer to the nurse because you're trying to save the local farmhand, Jourm (じょう), and you can't do it. He's bleeding a lot, and you don't know what to do.
It makes sense to defer to the knowledge of a medical professional. When going through this story, imagine yourself trying to revive Jourm, but nothing you do works. That's why you defer to the nurse. "Save Jourm," you say. "He's just a simple, kinda weird, ten foot tall farmhand with nine toes."
